conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_E is my first-choice school because I’m excited by the academic environment and I’m ready to contribute strongly in classes and activities. I would like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Go for my top choice first. School_E is #1 on my true list, and I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so an early direct application gives me the best chance before seats fill.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_E as your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority order is Student_E > Student_B > Student_A > Student_D > Student_C, with quota 1. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_A, Student_D, Student_B, and Student_E. Since Student_E (my top choice) has applied and would accept an offer, accepting Student_A now would block matching with a higher-priority candidate. Therefore I should reject Student_A to preserve the seat for Student_E (or, if needed, Student_B).

conversation.message: School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying because School_E is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit enthusiastically if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application—please let me know if there’s anything I can share to support my candidacy.
conversation.thought: Apply immediately to my top choice, School_E. Although School_E ranks me 4th, early application is best because capacity is 1 and other strong competitors (Student_B, Student_A) also rank School_E first. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase my chance of acceptance if higher-priority students do not apply or later withdraw.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing this round’s applicants and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: Student_D is 4th on School_E’s true priority list, while Student_E (1st) and Student_B (2nd) are also applying this round, with quota 1. Since we can accept only one and higher-priority candidates are available now, accepting Student_D would block a better match. Therefore reject Student_D to preserve capacity for Student_E/Student_B.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first-choice school because I’m excited by the academic environment and would strongly commit if admitted. I believe I can contribute positively to the community and would be honored to join. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. I also have strong priority there (2nd, behind Student_E). Applying immediately maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills, and even if Student_E applies, I’m still a top candidate relative to others.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_E as your first-choice school. After reviewing this round’s applicants and considering our limited capacity, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We sincerely appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: As School_E with quota 1, I should accept the highest-ranked student on my true priority list among current applicants. My priority order is Student_E > Student_B > Student_A > Student_D > Student_C. In this round, Student_E and Student_B both applied; Student_E outranks Student_B, so to maximize my outcome I should reserve the seat for Student_E and reject Student_B. Student_B also has School_E as first choice, but accepting them would forgo the chance to match with my top choice who is currently applying. Therefore, reject Student_B.

conversation.message: Hello School_E—I'm Student_E. I’m excited about the opportunity to join your school and believe I’d be a strong fit for your community. I’d like to formally apply and would be honored to accept an offer if available.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th, so an early application risks rejection if higher-priority students apply. School_E is my last choice, but it ranks me 1st, so applying now should secure a guaranteed match and avoid being left unmatched if I lose competitions at my higher choices. I will lock in School_E immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_E. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We would be excited to welcome you to our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and have received applications from multiple students, including Student_B (#2), Student_A (#3), and Student_D (#4). Accepting Student_E immediately secures our top-choice match and is also consistent with Student_E’s willingness to accept an offer. There is no strategic benefit to delaying because we cannot do better than #1, and accepting now prevents losing the seat to later-round dynamics.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be ready to commit if admitted. I’m submitting my formal application and would be grateful for your consideration.
